1904060.book: The Seeing Of Rasoolullah In a Dream
1904060.reference:
Reference  : Shama'il Muhammadiyah 1904060
In-book reference  : Book 56, Hadith 001
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 56, Hadith 001
1904060.text: 'Abdullah ibn Mas'ud, that the Prophet said (Allah bless him and give him peace): “If someone sees me in his sleep, he has indeed seen me, for Satan cannot imitate me!"

1904070.book: The Seeing Of Rasoolullah In a Dream
1904070.reference:
Reference  : Shama'il Muhammadiyah 1904070
In-book reference  : Book 56, Hadith 002
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 56, Hadith 002
1904070.text: Abu Huraira (may Allah be well pleased with him) said: “Allah’s Messenger said (Allah bless him and give him peace): ‘If someone sees me in his sleep, he has indeed seen me, for Satan cannot appear in disguise as me’(or: ‘cannot imitate me’).”

1904081.book: The Seeing Of Rasoolullah In a Dream
1904081.reference:
Reference  : Shama'il Muhammadiyah 1904081
In-book reference  : Book 56, Hadith 003
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 56, Hadith 003
1904081.text: Abu Malik al-Ashja'i reported that his father said: "Allah’s Messenger said (Allah bless him and give him peace): “If someone sees me in his sleep, he has indeed seen me!”

1904082.book: The Seeing Of Rasoolullah In a Dream
1904082.reference:
Reference  : Shama'il Muhammadiyah 1904082
In-book reference  : Book 56, Hadith 004
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 56, Hadith 004
1904082.text: Khalaf ibn Khalifa said: “I saw Amr ibn Huraith, the Companion of the Prophet (Allah bless him and give him peace), when I was a little boy.”

1904090.book: The Seeing Of Rasoolullah In a Dream
1904090.reference:
Reference  : Shama'il Muhammadiyah 1904090
In-book reference  : Book 56, Hadith 005
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 56, Hadith 005
1904090.text: 'Asim ibn Kulaib’s father heard Abu Huraira say: “Allah’s Messenger (Allah bless him and give him peace) said: ‘If someone sees me in his sleep, he has indeed seen me, for Satan cannot imitate me!’ The father then related this to Ibn Abbas, saying that he had seen the Prophet. He also mentioned al-Hasan ibn ‘Ali, noting that he resembled the Prophet. To this Ibn 'Abbas replied, ‘Yes, he resembled him.’”

1904100.book: The Seeing Of Rasoolullah In a Dream
1904100.reference:
Reference  : Shama'il Muhammadiyah 1904100
In-book reference  : Book 56, Hadith 006
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 56, Hadith 006
1904100.text: Yazid al-Farisi, who used to inscribe copies of the Qur’an said: “I saw the Prophet (Allah bless him and give him peace) in my sleep in the time of Ibn 'Abbas, so I said to Ibn 'Abbas: ‘I saw Allah’s Messenger (Allah bless him and give him peace) in my sleep!’ Ibn 'Abbas said: “Allah’s Messenger (Allah bless him and give him peace) used to say: ‘Satan cannot imitate me, so if someone sees me in his sleep, he has indeed seen me!’ Can you describe this man whom you saw in your sleep?” “Yes,” he said. “I shall describe for you an average man: his body and his flesh were brown-to-white; he was black eyed, endowed with a pleasant smile and handsome facial features; his beard went from here to here, and it came down over the top of his chest.” 'Awf said: "I do not know what could be added to this description,” and Ibn 'Abbas said: "If you had seen him in the state of wakefulness, you could not have described him more accurately than this.”

1904110.book: The Seeing Of Rasoolullah In a Dream
1904110.reference:
Reference  : Shama'il Muhammadiyah 1904110
In-book reference  : Book 56, Hadith 007
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 56, Hadith 007
1904110.text: (Regarding one of the narrators of the previous narration) `Awf (Abu Jamilah) al-A`rabi said: "I am older then Qatadah."

1904120.book: The Seeing Of Rasoolullah In a Dream
1904120.reference:
Reference  : Shama'il Muhammadiyah 1904120
In-book reference  : Book 56, Hadith 008
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 56, Hadith 008
1904120.text: Abu Qatada said: “Allah’s Messenger said (Allah bless him and give him peace): ‘If someone sees me (meaning in his sleep), he has seen me truly!'”

1904130.book: The Seeing Of Rasoolullah In a Dream
1904130.reference:
Reference  : Shama'il Muhammadiyah 1904130
In-book reference  : Book 56, Hadith 009
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 56, Hadith 009
1904130.text: Anas said: "The Prophet said (Allah bless him and give him peace): 'If someone sees me in his sleep, he has indeed seen me, for Satan cannot impersonate me!' He also said: 'The vision of the believer is one of forty-six parts of Prophethood.'"

1904140.book: The Seeing Of Rasoolullah In a Dream
1904140.reference:
Reference  : Shama'il Muhammadiyah 1904140
In-book reference  : Book 56, Hadith 010
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 56, Hadith 010
1904140.text: Abdu llah ibn al-Mubarak said: “If you are afflicted with the responsibility of judgeship, you must follow the [Prophetic] tradition [al-athar]!”

1904150.book: The Seeing Of Rasoolullah In a Dream
1904150.reference:
Reference  : Shama'il Muhammadiyah 1904150
In-book reference  : Book 56, Hadith 011
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 56, Hadith 011
1904150.text: Ibn Sirin said: "This tradition [hadith] is religion, so consider from whom you accept your religion.”
